main event: A bright, flashing white light was observed in the sky near Baltimore, Maryland on September 6, 1952.
interesting points: The light was observed by personnel at the Baltimore Filter Center, including 2nd Lt. Baxter T. Duncan, T/Sgt. Ira Wilson, and Mr. Fred Simon from TV station WAAM.
The light appeared at regular 60-second intervals, lasting 1-2 seconds each time.
Test firing at the nearby Aberdeen Proving Ground was determined to be the likely cause of the sighting.
Two F-94 fighter jets from the 148th F-I Squadron at Dover AFB were vectored to search the area, and they reported seeing a flashing white light in the southeast corner of Aberdeen Proving Ground.
The weather conditions at the time included a clear sky, 5-mile visibility, light haze, and winds aloft from various directions.
result: Likely explained by military test firing at Aberdeen Proving Ground
witnesses: Personnel at Baltimore Filter Center, including military officers and a TV station employee
